page.title: 02Upton River Activities.
page.content: Upton's stretch of the{river Severn}is both powerful and unpredictable, not always apparent to visitors. Swimming is dangerous and not permitted. The town quayside is always busy with both private and hired narrow boats alongside. Many visitors then visit the shops, pubs and restaurants in the town. The{"Conway Castle"}steamer takes visitors up and down the river, wines and dines them en route,daytime and at night.At East waterside is a busy{Marina,}with first class facilities for berth holders and visitors, including hire boats, boat sales, moorings, slipway, chandlery, boat hoist and fuel.Upton has its own angling club and the local tackle shop, in Old Street,will issue licences.
